frame.name: Custom
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Behavior</fen> is classified as entrenched for a <fen>Protagonist</fen> or a <fen>Society</fen>. The <fen>Behavior</fen> may be associated with a particular <fen>Domain</fen> of experience and described with a <fen>Descriptor</fen>. This indicates that the <fen>Behavior</fen> is commonly performed by the <fen>Protagonist</fen> or members of the <fen>Society</fen>.
<ex>It is an <fex name="Descriptor">old</fex> <fex name="Society">Jewish</fex> <t>custom</t>. </ex> <ex>He was unaware of the <fex name="Society">Japanese</fex> <t>custom</t> <fex name="Behavior">of waiting until the giver had departed</fex>. </ex> <ex> The <fex name="Descriptor">ancient</fex> <t>tradition</t> <fex name="Behavior">of swan-upping</fex> has been taking place on the river Thames.</ex> <ex>Smithers thought that <fex name="Behavior">hunting lions</fex> was just another <fex name="Society">native</fex> <t>custom</t> </ex> <ex>Marko showed great respect for the <fex name="Domain">social</fex> <t>customs</t> <fex name="Society">of his people</fex>.</ex> <ex> When I reply to debates , it is <fex name="Protagonist">my</fex> <t>custom</t> <fex name="Behavior">to have heard all the speeches that have been made</fex>. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Behavior
FE.definition: <def-root>This Frame Element marks expressions that indicate the entrenched <fen>Behavior</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Protagonist
FE.definition:
<def-root>This Frame Element marks expressions that indicate whose entrenched <fen>Behavior</fen> is at issue.
<ex> <fex name="Protagonist">His</fex> <t>custom</t> was to come here for the 10 o'clock service. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Domain
FE.definition:
<def-root>This Frame Element marks expressions that indicate the area of human experience to which the <fen>Behavior</fen> belongs.
<ex> Witali tried to understand their <fex name="Domain">religious</fex> <t>customs</t>. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE marks expressions that indicate attributes, traits, or evaluations of the entrenched <fen>Behavior</fen>.
<ex>In the year 2100, a historian will undertake a study of that <fex name="Descriptor">quaint</fex> <t>custom</t> of preserving public footpaths across private land .</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE marks expressions that indicate a region where the <fen>Behavior</fen> is entrenched.
<ex>They found that a loca <t>custom</t> <fex name="Place">in the country</fex> was to walk around barefoot at all times of the year and in all weathers .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Society
FE.definition: <def-root> <ex>We can help , you to meet Egyptian people and learn about <fex name="Society">Egyptian</fex> <t>customs</t>. </ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: custom.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a traditional and widely accepted way of behaving or doing something that is specific to a particular society, place, or time.

lexUnit.name: practice.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the customary or expected procedure or way of doing something.

lexUnit.name: ritual.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a series of actions habitually and invariably followed by someone.

lexUnit.name: tradition.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a long-established custom or belief passed on in this way.

lexUnit.name: habit.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a settled or regular tendency or practice

lexUnit.name: convention.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a settled or regular tendency or practice

lexUnit.name: traditional.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: of, relating to, or following tradition.

lexUnit.name: ritualistic.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: being related with regular observance or practice of ritual, especially when excessive or without regard to its function.

lexUnit.name: habitual.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: done constantly or as a habit.

lexUnit.name: customary.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: in accordance with custom; usual.

lexUnit.name: traditionally.adv
lexUnit.definition: FN: (of an action) according to tradition.

lexUnit.name: ways.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: practices of a person or group of people
